title: Lag with 40-100 ping

embed.description: During most of Netalyzr's execution, the client continuously measures the state of the network in the background, looking for short outages. During testing, the client observed 1 such outages. The longest outage lasted for 6.8 seconds. This suggests a general problem with the network where connectivity is intermittent.

body: I have been lagging a lot recently due to the amount of people on my internet but now I have encountered an issue where I dc at 40 ping quite frequently, I have posted my netalyzr results and would be grateful if anyone can take a look and help me out.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Your connection seems to be suffering from a lot of issues, are you running any software in the background (Skype, any streaming service, etc) that may be causing the high packet buffering rate seen from your netalyzr results?

Could you do the following for me,

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/). (Again)
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
